hero.title: FitGN Rail — Modular locking Gastronorm rails
hero.subtitle: FitGN Rail is a modular kit of thick-gauge stainless rails that locks standard GN pans in place. Lay the rails over any bain-marie or saladette, click the segments together, and every opening stays aligned — no flex, no rattle.
hero.supporting: Build the exact service grid you need with GN 1/1, 1/2, 1/3, 1/4, 1/6, and 1/9 rails that interlock in seconds and hold their geometry through the rush.

problem.title: When rails slip, service slows
problem.body: Loose Gastronorm rails slide, bow, and clatter with every ladle bump. Kitchens waste minutes reseating pans, risk broken cold chains, and end up with inconsistent presentation. Makeshift fixes like tape or silicone wedges fail after a few washes — everyone simply "lives with it."

solution.title: Click-lock rails that stay put
solution.body: FitGN Rail retrofits any GN well with stainless rails that mechanically lock together. The click geometry resists vibration, keeps trays perfectly level, and lifts out for nightly cleaning — no drilling, adhesives, or custom wells.

features.title: Modular GN layout
features.text: Combine GN 1/1 down to GN 1/9 rails to mirror any mise en place without custom fabrication.

features.title: Rigid thick-gauge inox
features.text: Oversized profiles resist bending across wide wells so pans never develop a wobble.

features.title: Tool-less retrofit
features.text: Drop the rails in, click them tight, and lift them out for nightly cleaning in seconds.

lineup.title: One kit, every Gastronorm opening
lineup.body: Select the rail segments you need, click them together, and you have a locked grid tailored to today’s menu — swap layouts as fast as you swap pans.

sizes.title: GN 1/1
sizes.text: Spans the full well to form the structural backbone for wide bain-marie openings.

sizes.title: GN 1/2
sizes.text: Pairs with 1/1 segments to anchor mixed 1/2 and 1/4 lineups without flexing.

sizes.title: GN 1/3
sizes.text: Bridges saladette wells for trio pan runs and stabilises taller inserts.

sizes.title: GN 1/4
sizes.text: Fills the gaps for hot garnish wells or dessert lines with compact trays.

sizes.title: GN 1/6
sizes.text: Locks narrow sauce and topping pans in place so nothing tilts during service.

sizes.title: GN 1/9
sizes.text: Finishes the grid for prep-heavy lines — perfect for condiments and mise cups.

about.title: Born from a kitchen problem
about.body: Koen Mortier has operated Fitchen restaurants for over a decade and knows the GN struggle firsthand. After years of searching across Europe — including the latest supplier tour in November 2025 — every answer was the same: there is no solution, kitchens just “live with it.” Pauline De Schepper, a hospitality management student who spends her spare time on the line, was equally tired of chasing runaway pans. Together they designed the FitGN Rail so Belgian kitchens can finally lock their mise en place.
proofPoints: 10+ years of multi-site Fitchen service informs every tolerance and hygiene detail.
Hundreds of hours lost to reseating GN strips inspired the click geometry that now holds firm.
Tested daily in Gent before partner pilots — if it survives a Saturday rush there, it will in yours.

steps.title: Drop-in base
steps.text: Set the low-profile base into the GN well — no screws, no adhesives.

steps.title: Click the rails
steps.text: Slide each rail until it locks with its neighbour. The grid aligns itself and stays rigid.

steps.title: Service & clean
steps.text: Swap pans at speed. Lift the base after service; the open profile rinses and dries fast.

flemish.title: Flemish-built for relentless service
flemish.body: FitGN Rail is engineered and fabricated in Flanders, where dense horeca networks and stainless expertise set a high bar. We treat "Made in Flanders" as a mark of precision workmanship.

pillars.title: Kitchen-grade inox
pillars.text: 304/316 stainless throughout, deburred edges, and weldless joints to meet HACCP standards.

pillars.title: Fabricated in Flanders
pillars.text: Local partners laser-cut and form every rail so we control tolerances down to the millimetre.

pillars.title: Reliability by design
pillars.text: Rails are stress-tested against vibration and heat cycles so chefs focus on service, not hardware.
